sub_title: Publisher | Writer | Senior Editor - Religious Studies
summary: Result-oriented publishing professional with 10+ years of experience. Known for strategic, data driven, financially focused development of quality academic, trade, and K12 lists. Experienced team lead with demonstrable ability to coach target driven teams. A proven track record in operations, stakeholder management, acquisitions, marketing, and portfolio development. A journalist, comic writer, and bestselling novelist when not a publisher.

treasury_media.title: Magazine
treasury_media.description: Jellyfish Monthly is a children's current affair and entertainment magazine with over 4,000 subscribers. I'm one of three founding partner, and the founding editor of Jellyfish Monthly. Please find a few sample pages and articles below.

treasury_media.title: Book Editorial
treasury_media.description: As commissioning editor at Pratham Books, my job was to manage the production of 30 picture books from conceptualization to production. My list focused on STEM, particularly on simple engineering and technology books for 4 to 8-year-olds, and included a mix of fiction, narrative nonfiction, comics, nonfiction, as well as AV and gif books. When I Grow Up by Priyadarshini Gogoi and Tarique Aziz went on to win the 2020 FIP (Federation of Book Publishers) award.

school.name: Motilal Nehru National Institute Of Technology

profile_positions.description: My responsibilities include managing and growing the religious studies portfolio by cultivating relationships with writers, editors, and academics to develop book projects from ideation to publication. To employ a data driven commissioning approach to explore emerging fields and growth areas within the religious studies program; take on tasks such as contract negotiations, providing editorial feedback, and representing Springer Nature at conferences; as well as ensuring editorial objectives are met by aligning goals with marketing, production, sales and Springer Nature’s larger OA vision.
profile_positions.title: Senior Publishing Editor - Religious Studies (Books)

profile_positions.description: As a starting member of the content acquisition team, I worked towards acquiring high-value content in close collaboration with the Journals teams. I worked alongside EiCs and Publishers towards the strategic development of the journals in my portfolio, liaising and building relationships with the Physics and Applied sciences communities and developing key internal and external stakeholder relationships to support the goals of the journals. Some of my achievements include developing, analysing and improving current workflows by identifying areas for improvement; developing and implemented a training plan for my colleagues; forging inter-departmental relationships to meet the strategic goals of my team; help build a robust network of guest editors, editorial board members, and academics within the context of collections and special issues.
profile_positions.title: Commissioning Editor

profile_positions.description: As a Publishing Operations Administrator, I have gained valuable insight about scientific publishing and the peer review process, as well as gained a wealth of knowledge working in the operations division of publishing. I had the opportunity to train on various content management systems, familiarise myself with support roles, and take on limited Implementation Manager responsibilities. Working in the waivers department has also given me a bird’s eye view of Springer’s open access policies and strategies, and the way institutional and transformative agreements drive open access publication.
profile_positions.title: Publishing Operations Administrator

profile_positions.description: A six-month-long project where I'm in charge of working with writers, illustrators, designers, and other stakeholders to commission a children's Graphic Novel as well as oversee the implementation and completion of 4 existing Graphic novels and make them print-ready.
profile_positions.title: Editorial Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
I work in children's publishing as well as K-12 educational publishing, and have worked with some of the biggest trade and educational publishers in India. I've managed textbook projects for Pearson Publishers, early STEM book projects for Oxford University Press and have adapted, produced and provided content for almost all the major Indian educational publishers. I've worked with trade publishers such as Scholastic, Puffin, Hachette and Pratham books and have edited and worked on several books across different genres and levels.

I'm familiar with the various syllabus systems, and have produced, edited and managed works of fiction, non-fiction, and workbooks with set objectives. I have also edited, art directed and managed illustration and animation projects, as well as produce and enable new age digital content.

In addition to my editing and content services, I also take on large management projects as a consultant, as well as provide rights and permissions to my catalogue of work. Some of my clients including Pearson Publishers, Oxford University Press, Pratham Books, Lifelab, Buzzfeed.
profile_positions.title: Editor | Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Commissioned and managed (from conception to print) the production of 30 STEM picture books, 6 audio video books and 4 GIF books as part of a CSR grant for CISCO. Many of the books commissioned have gone on to win awards and recognition. The FICC (Federation of Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry award) and the Parag Honour list to name a couple. 

My role at Pratham books was to head a team of four, and produce 120 books (30 books across 4 languages) within a span of a year.
profile_positions.title: Commissioning Editorial Head

profile_positions.description: Founded and managed Jellyfish Monthly, the children's news and entertainment magazine. My responsibilities included working with illustrators, writers, and editors; as well as working against the clock to produce a monthly magazine comprising of a diverse range of topics (comics, short stories, news, activities, STEM concepts, history and science to list a few).
profile_positions.title: Managing Editor

profile_positions.description: Managed a series of eight text books from conception to print. My job was to manage and work alongside a team of illustrators, designers, writers and subject matter experts to put together a series of eight textbooks.
profile_positions.title: Editorial Project Manager

profile_positions.description: The role required an enthusiastic tour guide, eager to help people with their visit to Old Chennai, particularly George Town. It was my job to plan different aspects of the tour, like travel, food, and safety, as well as research new routes.
profile_positions.title: Tour Guide
